title: Incoming ECB President Lagarde says big European countries aren't spending enough: report
text: Christine Lagarde, the incoming president of the European Central Bank, has criticized the governments of Germany and the Netherlands for not using big budget surpluses to help stimulate their economies. Lagarde made the comments in an interview with France's RTL broadcaster, Reuters reported. "Those that have the room for maneuver, those that have a budget surplus, that's to say Germany, the Netherlands, why not use that budget surplus and invest in infra-structure? ... Why not invest in education, why not invest in innovation, to allow for a better re-balancing?" Lagarde said.
